en.title: Morning Minds & Night Owls ? тАФ Chronotype & Brain Efficiency Study
en.desc:
Circadian Preference, Sleep Patterns, and Their Association with Cognitive Efficiency, Mental Well-Being, and Productivity. This study explores how individual sleepтАУwake preferences (chronotypes) are associated with cognitive performance, mental well-being, and daily productivity.

Please answer all questions honestly based on your typical experiences over the past two weeks. There are no right or wrong answers. Your responses are completely anonymous and will be used only for academic research purposes.

Use the Next button to move forward.

sections.C: Section C тАФ Mental Well-being (Past 2 Weeks)
